selected_quotes: The Bacterial Nanorecorder: Engineering E. coli to Function as a Chemical Recording Device #synbio #syntheticbiology
Engineering E. coli to Function as a Chemical Recording Device
Utiliser des bactéries en tant que nanorecorders Chemical Recording Device Le bluetooth en option, c'est possible?
PLOS Collections: The Bacterial Nanorecorder: Engineering E. coli to Function as a Chemical Recordin

citation.abstract: Synthetic biology is an emerging branch of molecular biology that uses synthetic genetic constructs to create man-made cells or organisms that are capable of performing novel and/or useful applications. Using a synthetic chemically sensitive genetic toggle switch to activate appropriate fluorescent protein indicators (GFP, RFP) and a cell division inhibitor (minC), we have created a novel E. coli strain that can be used as a highly specific, yet simple and inexpensive chemical recording device. This biological "nanorecorder" can be used to determine both the type and the time at which a brief chemical exposure event has occurred. In particular, we show that the short-term exposure (15-30 min) of cells harboring this synthetic genetic circuit to small molecule signals (anhydrotetracycline or IPTG) triggered long-term and uniform cell elongation, with cell length being directly proportional to the time elapsed following a brief chemical exposure. This work demonstrates that facile modification of an existing genetic toggle switch can be exploited to generate a robust, biologically-based "nanorecorder" that could potentially be adapted to detect, respond and record a wide range of chemical stimuli that may vary over time and space.
citation.title: The Bacterial Nanorecorder: Engineering E. coli to Function as a Chemical Recording Device

facebook.summary:
toggle switch為合成生物學中強而有力的基因記憶原件，同時也是能夠對外界瞬間的刺激產生反應的開關。科學家利用其特性搭配大腸桿菌細胞分裂的週期性，製造出有時間標記功能的''奈米紀錄器"，其優點在於對小分子的誘導物(IPTG)進行短時間(15-30min)處理後有明顯的細胞增長表現。''奈米紀錄器"具備偵測不同種類以及反應時間之化學刺激的潛能。

資料來源:
http://www.ploscollections.org/article/info%3Adoi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.po
